page.title: 01LAND S.W. WEST HESLERTON
page.content: An area of flat fertile farmland originally part of post glacial "lake Pickering", crops of barley, wheat, sugar beet, potatoes and oil seed rape. Kale and turnips for sheep feed. The A64 Leeds to Scarborough bisects area which rises south of the road to form beginning of Yorkshire Wolds. The long distance walk "Wolds Way" traverses block. Several shelter belts plus Knapton Plantation originally part of Wintringham Estate. Mainly coniferous trees. Taken over by Forestry Commission.
